items.title: SF to reopen and expand more businesses and activities within the Orange Tier on April 15
items.summary: Starting April 15, San Francisco will resume indoor live-audience events, performances, meetings, and receptions with capacity limits and following other protocols, and will expand existing guidelines for outdoor live-audience events, performances, and other activities.

items.title: People 16 and older are now eligible to receive the COVID-19 vaccine in San Francisco
items.summary: Nearly 60% of people 16 and older in San Francisco have received at least one dose of the vaccine. The City is currently vaccinating roughly 12,000 residents per day.

items.title: San Francisco announces plans for indoor live ticketed events
items.summary: Next Thursday San Francisco will issue formal guidelines to allow live performances, meetings, and other events with capacity limits in indoor settings to begin starting April 15.

items.title: San Francisco launches new neighborhood vaccination site in the Excelsior District as part of equity strategy
items.summary: Operated in partnership with Excelsior Strong and Latino Task Force, the new vaccination site offers low-barrier access to vaccines in a diverse neighborhood that is home to many essential workers and others at risk of COVID-19

items.title: People age 50 and older are now eligible to receive the COVID vaccine in San Francisco
items.summary: Expansion in eligibility comes as nearly 50% of the adult population of San Francisco has received at least one dose of the COVID-19 vaccine.

items.title: Offices, outdoor bars, indoor fitness classes, and other activities allowed as SF moves into Orange Tier
items.summary: All patrons must wear face coverings. Reopening places must have additional safety plans in place.
